channel.title: Sidekick 3 unlock
channel.description: if i unlock the phone and put new software on it would i be abel to use mp3s as ringtones or is it a waste of time

item.title: Sidekick 3 unlock
item.dc:creator: @coolguydg17 coolguydg17
item.description:
@coolguydg17 wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

That really doesn’t deserve an answer. You don’t unlock a Cell Phone to get into the secure directories, you use it to use a Verizon phone with the at&t network and vise versa . And as far as I know you can use mp3’s for ringtones. You just have to have a program to convert it or transfer it to the phone.

well if i woulda known that i wouldnt of asked so dont say it doesnt deserve an answer

Read full topic

item.title: Sidekick 3 unlock
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:3, topic:170423”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=230329.msg1973393#msg1973393 date=1199384472]
That really doesn’t deserve an answer. You don’t unlock a Cell Phone to get into the secure directories, you use it to use a Verizon phone with the at&t network and vise versa . And as far as I know you can use mp3’s for ringtones. You just have to have a program to convert it or transfer it to the phone.
[/quote]
Errm, not quite. Verizon and CDMA and Cingular (AT&T) is GSM. You’d unlock a Verizon phone so it could use Nextel or Sprint, and you’d unlock a T-Mobile/Alltel/Rogers/AT&T phone to use another carrier on the same channel-space.

Unlocking the phone just means that you are removing the SIM card block that T-Mobile placed on your phone, so that you’ll be able to use other GSM carriers (The Sidekick is a phone that operates on the GSM protocol on GSM frequencies)
I don’t recommend that you do it, though, as your phone will lose the ability yo do a lot of things, such as email, etc. Those are stored on Danger’s servers (Danger Inc. made the Sidekick), and, if I recall correctly, you’d need a SIM card from T-Mobile for your phone to access the servers. Just get an unlocked Motorola phone, or buy one and unlock it yourself (it’s really easy)

Hopefully that helps. :D[/quote]

Meh, I was just using Verizon and at&t as an example.

Read full topic

item.title: Sidekick 3 unlock
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

That really doesn’t deserve an answer. You don’t unlock a Cell Phone to get into the secure directories, you use it to use a Verizon phone with the at&t network and vise versa . And as far as I know you can use mp3’s for ringtones. You just have to have a program to convert it or transfer it to the phone.

Or you can just jailbreak your iPhone then install SendSong, choose a song, and press “Use as ringtone”. Bam, you have it as your ringtone…

Read full topic

item.title: Sidekick 3 unlock
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Errm, not quite. Verizon and CDMA and Cingular (AT&T) is GSM. You’d unlock a Verizon phone so it could use Nextel or Sprint, and you’d unlock a T-Mobile/Alltel/Rogers/AT&T phone to use another carrier on the same channel-space.

Unlocking the phone just means that you are removing the SIM card block that T-Mobile placed on your phone, so that you’ll be able to use other GSM carriers (The Sidekick is a phone that operates on the GSM protocol on GSM frequencies)
I don’t recommend that you do it, though, as your phone will lose the ability yo do a lot of things, such as email, etc. Those are stored on Danger’s servers (Danger Inc. made the Sidekick), and, if I recall correctly, you’d need a SIM card from T-Mobile for your phone to access the servers. Just get an unlocked Motorola phone, or buy one and unlock it yourself (it’s really easy)

Hopefully that helps.

Read full topic
